title.narrative: 1.2. PUBLIC INVESTMENTS AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR FAMILIES AND CHILDREN

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF LABOUR AND SOCIAL RESEARCH

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Local governance related (national subnational, local) policies programmes, plans and/or budgets
PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF has laid the foundation for public finance for children interventions within key Government reform processes, including costing, linking of planning and budgeting processes and investment case development at national and local level, with a particular focus on consolidated communities of Armenia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

title.narrative: Local government (incl. municipalities) with budget allocated to child priorities, Percent
Local government (incl. municipalities) with budget allocated to child priorities, Percent
Local government (incl. municipalities) with budget allocated to child priorities, Percent
Local government (incl. municipalities) with budget allocated to child priorities, Percent
Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children, Text

baseline.value: The budgeting process does not include a child rights perspective and does not specify clear allocations to boys and girls in the relevant sectors and agencies

target.value: 2025:The budgeting process includes child rights perspective and specifies clear allocations to boys and girls in the relevant sectors and agencies, including specific indicators and a tracking system

actual.value: 2021:The budgeting process does not include a child rights perspective and does not specify clear allocations to boys and girls in the relevant sectors and agencies
